English.Char_Desc_80: The framework allows scripts to be written with JavaScript syntax and bash statements.
English.Char_Desc_250: /bin/js scripts are a mash-up of JavaScript and bash. Simple bash code is valid. Simple JavaScript code is valid. And you can mash-up both. Pipes and redirects and all the wonders of bash one-liners are available. The net result of this is a very comfortable way to write scripts, the final code is self-explanatory and natural, you can increment a variable in a script with i++ instead of i=$((i + 1)). The code you write looks like code, and the lines of bash commands look exactly like you would type them on the command line.
